member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.PartSvcContract.ChangeMRPWarning(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String@)
member.summary: When the ProcessMRP flag for a Part/Plant is changed from Yes to No all related unfirm jobs will be deleted when the record is committed to the database. You can use this method to provide a warning to the user of this fact and provide a confirmation dialog. This is intended to be called upon value change of the ProcessMRP field. If there are existing unfirm Jobs for the given Part/PlantThis warningMsg will contain a translated text message which can be used to display in your message dialog. Otherwise it returns blanks and there is no need to provide a dialog.
member.param: Part number of the PartPlant record that is being updated.
Plant ID of the PartPlant record that is being updated .
New value of the PartPlant.ProcessMRP field.
Contains warning message text if jobs will be deleted by changing the ProcessMRP value.

member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.PartSvcContract.ChangePartBinInfoKBCode(System.String,Erp.Tablesets.PartTableset@)
member.summary: Used when the KBCode field of PartBinInfo is being changed to a new value. It will validate the new KBCode field. If it is valid the dataset will be updated with the new KBCode and related KBActionCode.
member.param: The new Kan Ban Type code field value.

The PartDataset. If valid, the NewKBCode will be returned in the dataset, along with a refreshed KBActionCode field. IMPORTANT, the PartWhse record must be sent as modified otherwise you will received error that record cannot be found.

member.summary: Used when the Buy To Order field of Part is being changed to a new value.
member.param: The new part Buy To Order value.

member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.PartSvcContract.ChangePartCommodityCode(System.String,Erp.Tablesets.PartTableset@)
member.summary: Used when the Part.CommodityCode field is being changed to a new value. It will validate the new value, passed in with newCommodityCode If it is valid the dataset will be updated with the new value and related values will be refreshed.
member.param: The PartDataset. IMPORTANT, the Part record must be sent as modified otherwise you will received error that record cannot be found.

member.param: The PartDataset. IMPORTANT, the Part record must be sent as modified otherwise you will received error that record cannot be found.

member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.PartSvcContract.ChangePartPlantSourceType(System.String,System.String@,System.String@,Erp.Tablesets.PartTableset@)
member.summary: Used when the SourceType field of PartPlant or the TypeCode of Part is being changed to a new value and the user selected to update the PartPlant records with the change. It will check to see if a configuration exists for the part. If a configuration exists it will return a warning message in ruleMessage that should be displayed to the user as a warning. If the configuration is not marked as single-level configuration then a message will be returned in singleLevelConfMsg which should be displayed to the user asking if they want to continue. If they answer Yes to continue then the method DeleteMultiLevelRules should be called.
member.param: If this message isn't returned as null then it should be displayed to the user.
If this message isn't returned as null then it should be displayed to the user.
The PartDataset. IMPORTANT, the PartPlant record must be sent as modified otherwise you will received error that record cannot be found.

member.summary: This method performs the actual logic behind linking a Part. It is run after the PreLinkGlbPart method which determines the Part Number to link to. If the Part Number is for a Part that already exists, the GlbPart information is translated and then copied to the PartDataSet as an update. If the Part Number is for a new Part, the GlbPart information is translated and then copied to the PartDataSet as an Add. Until the update method is run on Part record the Link process is not completed.

member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.PartSvcContract.PreLinkGlbPart(System.String,System.String,Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartTableset@,System.String@)
member.summary: Linking a GlbPart record ties a global record to a new or existing Vendor record so that any changes made to the GlbPart record in another company are automatically copied to any linked Parts. This method performs the pre link logic to check of okay to link or get the new partnum to create/link to. Will be run before LinkGlbPart which actually creates/updates a Part record and will send the modified record back for update. When the Link "button" is originally selected, the LinkPartNum will be defaulted to the GlbPartNum field. It will then check to see if this part number is available for Use. If available for use the system will return a question asking the user if they want to use this number. If the answer is no, then the user either needs to select an existing Part Number to link to or enter a brand new number. You will run this method until the user answer is yes. Then the LinkGlbPart method is called.
member.param: Global Company field on the GlbPart record to link
Global VendorNum field on the GlbPart record to link

Returns a message the user needs to respond yes or no to. If the user answers no, then they need to update the LinkPartNum field and then run this method again to test the new PartNum they want to link to

member.summary: Defines the Unit of Measure used when part is issued, this is also how it is stocked. Use the value from XaSyst.UM as a default when creating new part records.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.PUM
member.summary: The Purchasing Unit of measure for the Part. During Part Maintenance the XaSyst.UM is used as a default for this field. This is used in Purchase Order entry as the default on line item details.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.TypeCode
member.summary: Classifies Parts into the following... M = Manufactured Part. P = Purchased Part This type code does limit referencing any part in any way. For example a type "P" can be entered on a sales order, or a type "M" can be referenced in a Purchase Order. This field will also be used as a selection parameter in certain reports, such as Time Phase Requirements.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.NonStock
member.summary: A flag which indicates if this Part is not a stocked inventory item. This can be used so that "custom" built items which only exist per the customers order can be established as a valid part in order to provide default descriptions etc.... This can also be used for parts that are only purchased for direct use on jobs, but would normally never exist in inventory. This value will be used in report selection criteria. It also controls the default setting of the "Make" flag in order entry line items and the "Purchase" flag in Job material records. If a NoStock part is referenced in order entry then it defaults as "Make". If it is referenced on a job material requirement it will default as "Purchase"

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.PurchasingFactor
member.summary: This value is used to convert quantity when there is a difference in the vendors unit of measure and how it is stocked in inventory. Example is purchased in pounds, stocked in sheets. Formula: Issue Qty * Conversion Factor = Purchased Qty.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.UnitPrice
member.summary: Base Unit Selling Price for the Item. Maintainable only via Part Master Maintenance program. It is used as a default unit price on Sales Order line detail and on Invoice line details that are not referencing a sales order line.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.PricePerCode
member.summary: Indicates the pricing per quantity for this part. It can be "E" = per each, "C" = per hundred, "M" = per thousand. Maintainable only via Part Maintenance. The initial default is "E". Used as default PricePerCode in order entry and invoice entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.InternalUnitPrice
member.summary: Base Internal Unit Selling Price for the Item. Maintainable only via Part Master Maintenance program. If zero, then the external unit price (Part.UnitPrice) is used.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.InternalPricePerCode
member.summary: Indicates the internal pricing per quantity for this part. It can be "E" = per each, "C" = per hundred, "M" = per thousand. Maintainable only via Part Maintenance. The initial default is "E".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.ProdCode
member.summary: Product Group ID for the Part. This can be blank or must be valid in the ProdGrup file. This will be used for report sorting and selection. Also as a default in order entry, invoice entry and job entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.MfgComment
member.summary: Used to enter comments for manufacturing when this part is referenced on a job. These are copied to JobHead.Comment, JobAsmbl.Comment,JobMtl.MfgComment depending on the point of reference. Commens are printed on the routing report.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.PurComment
member.summary: Part Comments that will be used as a default for purchasing. These will be copied into the JobMtl.PurComment which then will be used to pass along to the PO when that JobMtl is referenced. It will also be copied into the PODetail.Comment field when the PO is buying the part for stock and not referencing a Job. View as an EDITOR widget. To be view-as EDITOR widget.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.CostMethod
member.summary: Defines the Costing method to be associated with this Part. Use the XaSyst.CostMethod as a default. When a unit cost is retrieved from the Part file the programs will use this field to determine which one of the Four sets of cost fields should be used. A = Use Average L= Use Last S = Use Standard T = Use Avg by lot(not found in XaSyst).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.TaxCatID
member.summary: Indicates the Tax Category for this Part. Used as a default to Order line items or Invoice line items. Can be left blank which indicates item is taxable. If entered must be valid in the TaxCat master file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.InActive
member.summary: Flag which indicates if the Part Master is considered as "Inactive". This flag will be used to exclude parts from certain searches and reports.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.LowLevelCode
member.summary: Internally assigned integer which indicates the deepest level of assembly indention that this part is used at. This is used by the Cost Rollup routines to control the order in which parts get costed. Part at the bottom (highest levelcode) Product structure are calculated first and continues up the chain, with the final assembly parts being processed last. This insures that when retrieving the cost of an assemblies components the components will already have had their cost rolled up.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.Method
member.summary: An internal flag which indicates that this part contains Method of Manufacture details (PartMtl/PartOpr records). We use this to avoid processing raw material part records during processes such as BOM Cost roll up, Indented BOM lists, etc...

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.TrackLots
member.summary: Indicates if Lot numbers are prompted for in transactions for this part. Backflushing and AutoReceiving functions are ignored when TrackLots = Yes.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.TrackDimension
member.summary: Indicates if this part is dimension tracked

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.DefaultDim
member.summary: Default dimension code for the part. Set by selecting a PartDim record as default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.TrackSerialNum
member.summary: Indicates if this part is serial number tracked

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.CommodityCode
member.summary: Intrastat goods classification code following the Intrastat Classification Nomenclature (ICN). The Commodity Code field can be blank to indicate the value from the part class or must be valid in the ICommCode (formerly called IStatGrp) master file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.WarrantyCode
member.summary: Unique code for the Warranty for this part

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.PhantomBOM
member.summary: A flag which indicates if this Part is a "Phantom BOM".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.SalesUM
member.summary: The Selling Unit of measure for the Part. During Part Maintenance the XaSyst.UM is used as a default for this field. This is used in Sales Order entry as the default on line item details.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.SellingFactor
member.summary:
This value is used to convert quantity when there is a difference in the customers unit of measure and how it is stocked in inventory. Example is sold in pounds, stocked in sheets.
Formula: Inventory Qty * Conversion Factor = Selling Qty.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.MtlBurRate
member.summary: The material burden rate for this part.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.NetWeight
member.summary: The Part's Unit Net Weight.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.UsePartRev
member.summary: NOTE: NOT IMPLEMENTED ON INITIAL 5.0.300 RELEASE. if Yes then the part effective revision is used. If No then the revision of the demand source is used (OrderDtl, JobMtl...)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.PartsPerContainer
member.summary: Default for label printing. Zero indicates that only one label should be produced for the entire quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.PartLength
member.summary: Part's length.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.PartWidth
member.summary: Part's width.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.PartHeight
member.summary: Part's Height.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.LotShelfLife
member.summary: Shelf life of a lot in days. Zero indicates unlimited shelf life.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.WebPart
member.summary: This is a Web saleable part

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.RunOut
member.summary: Indicates that the onhand quantity is to be consumed and no further replenishments should be made. Similar to Obsolete, however only warning messages will be issued to the user if they attempt new references.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.SubPart
member.summary: Indicates the default Substitute part number. This is optional. Must be one of the related PartSub records. This field is set indirectly when the user checks the default toggle box in Part Substitution dialog.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.Diameter
member.summary: Part's diameter.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.Gravity
member.summary: Part's gravity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.OnHold
member.summary: Indicates that the part is on hold. This feature can be used to indicate that a new part is not yet approved, that it is being phased out, has a quality issue, etc. Further demands/supplies of this part should not be made. Similar to an "Inactive" part. However at the moment it still may have an onhand balance, supply and demands and will be reflected in stock status reporting.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.OnHoldDate
member.summary: Date that part becomes obsolete. This can be set to a future date when the part should become obsolete.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.OnHoldReasonCode
member.summary: The reason code that links to a Reason master record, which indicates why the part has been placed on hold. Valid only when Part.OnHold = Yes.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GlbPartRow.SellingFactorDirection

member.summary: A unique part number that identifies this part.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.SearchWord
member.summary: An abbreviated part description field by which the user can search the Part file. In Part maintenance the Search Word is to only be updated upon initial creation of the Part with the first 8 bytes of the Part.Description.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.PartDescription
member.summary: Describes the Part.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.ClassID
member.summary: The Inventory class that this Part belongs to. The Class field can be blank or must be valid in the PartClass master file. Classes could be set up for different type of raw materials. It will primarily be used as a report selection parameter.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.IUM
member.summary: Primary Inventory Unit of Measure. The unit costs, are based on this uom. Used as a default for issue transactions for the part. Part onhand and allocation quantities are tracked by this uom. The quantities can also be tracked by other uoms (see PartUOM table) but tracking at this uom is mandatory. Use UOMClass.DefUOMCode of the system default UOMClass when creating new part records (see XASyst.DefUOMClassID).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.PUM
member.summary: The Purchasing Unit of measure for the Part. During Part Maintenance the XaSyst.UM is used as a default for this field. This is used in Purchase Order entry as the default on line item details.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.TypeCode
member.summary: Classifies Parts into the following... M = Manufactured Part. P = Purchased Part This type code does limit referencing any part in any way. For example a type "P" can be entered on a sales order, or a type "M" can be referenced in a Purchase Order. This field will also be used as a selection parameter in certain reports, such as Time Phase Requirements.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.NonStock
member.summary: A flag which indicates if this Part is not a stocked inventory item. This can be used so that "custom" built items which only exist per the customers order can be established as a valid part in order to provide default descriptions etc.... This can also be used for parts that are only purchased for direct use on jobs, but would normally never exist in inventory. This value will be used in report selection criteria. It also controls the default setting of the "Make" flag in order entry line items and the "Purchase" flag in Job material records. If a NoStock part is referenced in order entry then it defaults as "Make". If it is referenced on a job material requirement it will default as "Purchase"

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.PurchasingFactor
member.summary:
This value is used to convert quantity when there is a difference in the vendors unit of measure and how it is stocked in inventory. Example is purchased in pounds, stocked in sheets.
Formula: Issue Qty * Conversion Factor = Purchased Qty.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.UnitPrice
member.summary: Base Unit Selling Price for the Item. Maintainable only via Part Master Maintenance program. It is used as a default unit price on Sales Order line detail and on Invoice line details that are not referencing a sales order line.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.PricePerCode
member.summary: Indicates the pricing per quantity for this part. It can be "E" = per each, "C" = per hundred, "M" = per thousand. Maintainable only via Part Maintenance. The initial default is "E". Used as default PricePerCode in order entry and invoice entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.InternalUnitPrice
member.summary: Base Internal Unit Selling Price for the Item. Maintainable only via Part Master Maintenance program. If zero, then the external unit price (Part.UnitPrice) is used.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.InternalPricePerCode
member.summary: Indicates the internal pricing per quantity for this part. It can be "E" = per each, "C" = per hundred, "M" = per thousand. Maintainable only via Part Maintenance. The initial default is "E".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.ProdCode
member.summary: Product Group ID for the Part. This can be blank or must be valid in the ProdGrup file. This will be used for report sorting and selection. Also as a default in order entry, invoice entry and job entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.MfgComment
member.summary: Used to enter comments for manufacturing when this part is referenced on a job. These are copied to JobHead.Comment, JobAsmbl.Comment,JobMtl.MfgComment depending on the point of reference. Commens are printed on the routing report.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.PurComment
member.summary: Part Comments that will be used as a default for purchasing. These will be copied into the JobMtl.PurComment which then will be used to pass along to the PO when that JobMtl is referenced. It will also be copied into the PODetail.Comment field when the PO is buying the part for stock and not referencing a Job. View as an EDITOR widget. To be view-as EDITOR widget.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.CostMethod
member.summary: Defines the Costing method to be associated with this Part. Use the XaSyst.CostMethod as a default. When a unit cost is retrieved from the Part file the programs will use this field to determine which one of the Four sets of cost fields should be used. A = Use Average L= Use Last S = Use Standard T = Use Avg by lot(not found in XaSyst).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.UserChar1
member.summary: User Defined character field. Actual label used is defined in the XaSyst record. This Field is only accessible if XaSyst.PartUserChar1Label is non blank.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.UserChar2
member.summary: User Defined character field. Actual label used is defined in the XaSyst record. This Field is only accessible if XaSyst.PartUserChar2Label is non blank.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.UserChar3

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.TaxCatID
member.summary: Indicates the Tax Category for this Part. Used as a default to Order line items or Invoice line items. Can be left blank which indicates item is taxable. If entered must be valid in the TaxCat master file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.InActive
member.summary: Flag which indicates if the Part Master is considered as "Inactive". This flag will be used to exclude parts from certain searches and reports.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.LowLevelCode
member.summary: Internally assigned integer which indicates the deepest level of assembly indention that this part is used at. This is used by the Cost Rollup routines to control the order in which parts get costed. Part at the bottom (highest levelcode) Product structure are calculated first and continues up the chain, with the final assembly parts being processed last. This insures that when retrieving the cost of an assemblies components the components will already have had their cost rolled up.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.Method
member.summary: An internal flag which indicates that this part contains Method of Manufacture details (PartMtl/PartOpr records). We use this to avoid processing raw material part records during processes such as BOM Cost roll up, Indented BOM lists, etc...

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.TrackLots
member.summary: Indicates if Lot numbers are prompted for in transactions for this part. Backflushing and AutoReceiving functions are ignored when TrackLots = Yes.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.TrackDimension
member.summary: Onhand quantity is always tracked in the Parts primary inventory uom (Part.IUM). Checking this box indicates that you want to allow tracking of onhand quantity by additional uoms. The actual UOMs to be tracked for the part are indicated by PartUOM.TrackOnHand. In order to set the PartUOM.TrackOhHand = True the Part.TrackDimension must = true. This replaces the old 8.3 Track Dimension feature

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.DefaultDim
member.summary: Default dimension code for the part. Set by selecting a PartDim record as default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.TrackSerialNum
member.summary: Indicates if this part is serial number tracked

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.CommodityCode
member.summary: Intrastat goods classification code following the Intrastat Classification Nomenclature (ICN). The Commodity Code field can be blank to indicate the value from the part class or must be valid in the ICommCode (formerly called IStatGrp) master file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.WarrantyCode
member.summary: Unique code for the Warranty for this part

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.PhantomBOM
member.summary: A flag which indicates if this Part is a "Phantom BOM".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.SalesUM
member.summary: The Selling Unit of measure for the Part. The UOM which the unit prices are based on. Defaults as the Part.IUM.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.SellingFactor
member.summary:
This value is used to convert quantity when there is a difference in the customers unit of measure and how it is stocked in inventory. Example is sold in pounds, stocked in sheets.
Formula: Inventory Qty * Conversion Factor = Selling Qty.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.PartsPerContainer
member.summary: Default for label printing. Zero indicates that only one label should be produced for the entire quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.OnHold
member.summary: Indicates that the part is on hold. This feature can be used to indicate that a new part is not yet approved, that it is being phased out, has a quality issue, etc. Further demands/supplies of this part should not be made. Similar to an "Inactive" part. However at the moment it still may have an onhand balance, supply and demands and will be reflected in stock status reporting.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.OnHoldDate

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.OnHoldReasonCode

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.RecDocReq

If checked, then at the time of receiving the system will require that one or more attachments with a reference to a DocType having Receipt = yes be entered.Requires DocManagement license.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.ShipDocReq

Pertains to Inventory shipments of lot tracked parts or shipments directly from the job only. If checked, then at the time of shipping the system will require that the PartLot.Ship DocsAvail, or JobPart.ShipDocsAvail flag is true before allowing the shipment.Requires DocManagement license.

member.summary: Indicates what VAT Reverse Charge method needs to be applied for this Part. The possible values are: "RCT" - "Reverse Charge with Threshold"; "RCN" - "Reverse Charge with No Threshold" Leave this field blank if no Reverse Charge should be applied in the invoice line for this Part.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.RCUnderThreshold
member.summary: Reverse Charge Under Threshold value. If the absolute value of an invoice line is less than the under threshold then the reverse charge tax code will be applied.

member.summary: Reverse Charge Over Threshold value. If the absolute value of an invoice line is more than the over threshold then the reverse charge tax code will be applied.

member.summary: The UOM Class that will be used for the Part. The UOM Class establishes the list of unit of measures that can be used in reference to this part. Must be valid in the UOMClass table.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.SNMaskPrefix

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.SNLastUsedSeq
member.summary: This is the last used serial sequence default. It is used only for the Mask Generate type to determine the next logical serial number to generate for this part/Site. It will be used when defaulting the SNLastUsedSeq field for new PartSite records.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.UseMaskSeq

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.NetWeightUOM
member.summary: Qualifies the unit of measure of the NetWeight field. Must be a UOMConv of the UOMClass with ClassType of "weight". Use UOMClass.DefUOMCode of the "weight" UOMClass as a default when creating new part records. Having a NetWeightUOM will provides the ability to calculate total weight.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRow.NetVolumeUOM
member.summary: Qualifies the unit of measure of the NewVolume field. Must be a UOMConv of the UOMClass with ClassType of "volume". Use UOMClass.DefUOMCode of the "volume" UOMClass as a default when creating new part records. Having a Net Volume UOM will provides the ability to calculate total volume

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.PrimWhse
member.summary: Defines which warehouse is to be used as the Primary Warehouse for this part in this Site. A primary warehouse is the one that this part is most commonly found in. This warehouse is used as the default in many programs, such as entry of sales order line

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.MinimumQty
member.summary: Indicates the desired minimum on-hand quantity. This is used by the time phase requirements report when user requests to show any parts that will or have fallen below this level. It is also used as a selection parameter for the inventory reorder report. This is an optional field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.MaximumQty
member.summary: Use to set a Maximum quantity limit that is desired to be on-hand. This field is used as a selection option by the inventory reorder report to show all parts that are over this limit. This field is optional.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.SafetyQty
member.summary: Safety quantity is a "purchasing cushion" limit. It's the amount you would need to have to cover your requirements until a shipment arrives from the vendor. If your on-hand quantity falls below this limit it means that there is a good chance that you will run out of material before the next shipment arrives. This value is used by the inventory reorder report and the time phase report. It is an optional field. Note: Safety + Minimum = Reorder Point... using this formula the reorder point is the amount at which to reorder to maintain at least the prescribed minimum quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.MinOrderQty
member.summary: Used to establish a suggested Order Qty when purchasing this Part for this Site. This value will be shown on the time phase report.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.LeadTime
member.summary: Used to record the normal order lead time for a Part for this Site. This value is represented in days. It is optional. Used in calculation of suggested order dates, as a default value in job material detail records.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.VendorNum
member.summary: Number of Vendor master that this part is normally purchased from. The Purchase Order Management module uses it. used in suggested vendor analysis.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.PurPoint
member.summary: Default Vendor purchase point ID.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.BackFlush
member.summary: Indicates if this part should be backflushed for this Site. Backflushing is the process of automatically issuing the material to jobs based on the operation quantity completed. When completed and scrap quantities are reported to a job operation (via labo

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.MfgLotSize
member.summary: This is the lot size that is used when performing a BOM cost rollup to distribute setup costs.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.MinMfgLotSize
member.summary: This is the minimum manufacturing lot size. If the required quantity is less than this amount then MRP will create a job with this production quantity. The excess amount will be sent to stock. Zero is no minimum. If nonzero, this field must be an even multiple of the MfgLotMultiple field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.MaxMfgLotSize
member.summary: This is the maximum manufacturing lot size. If the required quantity is greater than this amount then MRP will create additional job(s) to satisfy the required production quantity. Zero is no maximum. If nonzero, this field must be an even multiple of the MfgLotMultiple field. Example: Required Quantity = 500, Maximum Lot Size = 150, 4 jobs will be created with production quantities of 150, 150, 150, and 50.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.MfgLotMultiple
member.summary: This is the manufacturing lot size multiple. MRP will create jobs in multiples of this field. Any excess amount will be sent to stock. Zero is no lot multiple (lot-for-lot). Example: Required Quantity = 500, Lot Multiple = 150, Lot Maximum = 450, 2 jobs will be created with production quantities of 450, and 150.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.DaysOfSupply
member.summary: Used to record the normal order lead time for a Part for this Site. This value is represented in days. It is optional. Used in calculation of suggested order dates, as a default value in job material detail records.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.ReOrderLevel
member.summary: This is the flag indicating the inventory level we need to bring up to when it falls below re-order point(safety + minimum). Valid values are MAX and MIN.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.MRPRecalcNeeded
member.summary: System maintained field. Indicates that MRP needs to be recalculated for this part/Site.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.ProcessMRP
member.summary: Flag indicating if MRP should process this part.

member.summary: Flag indicating if PO suggestion should be generated for this part.

member.summary: This flag controls if a supply is always created in this Site for a part. If it is no then the default Site that provides a supply is from a part's product group unless the Site from product group is blank, in that case the default Site should be from the

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.TransferPlant

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.SourceType
member.summary: Indicates the normal source for this part in the Site. Values are; K = Sales Kit,M = Manufactured,P = Purchased,T = Transferred. Initial default is base on Part.TypeCode.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.TransferLeadTime
member.summary: Used to record the normal order lead time for a Part from the transfer Site to this Site. This value is represented in days. It is optional.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.PrepTime
member.summary: Used to determine the start date

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.ReceiveTime
member.summary: Days needed to move part to stock or next job. Deducted from Due Date.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.PlanTimeFence
member.summary: Days out from the current date when dates on jobs, PO, TO cannot be changed

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.ReschedOutDelta
member.summary: MRP parameter not to reschedule if number of days change below

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.ReschedInDelta
member.summary: Same as ReschedOutDelta but for messages

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.NonStock
member.summary: A flag which indicates if this Part is not a stocked inventory item. This can be used so that "custom" built items which only exist per the customers order can be established as a valid part in order to provide default descriptions etc.... This can also be used for parts that are only purchased for direct use on jobs, but would normally never exist in inventory. This value will be used in report selection criteria. It also controls the default setting of the "Make" flag in order entry line items and the "Purchase" flag in Job material records. If a NoStock part is referenced in order entry then it defaults as "Make". If it is referenced on a job material requirement it will default as "Purchase"

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.PhantomBOM
member.summary: A flag which indicates if this Part is a "Phantom BOM".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.BuyerID
member.summary: Identifies the Buyer for the part class. Used as the default in the Automated Purchasing process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.PersonID
member.summary: Identifies the Person to be used as the default Production Planner. This person is responsible for handling the manufacturing suggestions of parts in this Product Group. Used as the default for "new" manufacturing suggestions and on Job Header. Manufacturing suggestions can be filtered by Planner. Relates to the Person table.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.CostMethod
member.summary: Defines the Costing method to be associated with this Part. Use the XaSyst.CostMethod as a default. When a unit cost is retrieved from the Part file the programs will use this field to determine which one of the Four sets of cost fields should be used. A = Use Average L= Use Last S = Use Standard T = Use Avg by lot(not found in XaSyst).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.AltMethod
member.summary: Alternate Routing method to be used for this Part/Site

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.KitTime
member.summary: For Manufactured Parts to determine the Due date of the material

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.KitAllowUpdate
member.summary: Indicates if kit component lines can be added, deleted and modified during Sales Order and Quote entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.KitShipComplete
member.summary: Indicates if the parent kit part must be shipped complete or if kit components can be shipped in varying degrees of completeness. If this field is set to "No", then KitPricing must be set to "P" .

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.KitAllowChangeParms
member.summary: Indicates if changes the kit parameters is allowed during Sales Order and Quote entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.KitBackFlush
member.summary: Indicates if all components are to be backflushed when a kit parent item is shipped.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.KitPricing
member.summary: Indicates how kits will be priced. Values are: P = Kit Parent Pricing (The price is obtained from the sales price for the kit parent item), C = Component Pricing (The price is obtained from a rollup of kit component items).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.KitPrintCompsPS
member.summary: Indicates if kit components are to be printed on packing slips. If KitShipComplete is "Yes", then this field must be set to "Yes" as well.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.KitPrintCompsInv
member.summary: Indicates if kit components are to be printed on invoices. If KitShipComplete is "Yes", then this field must be set to "Yes" as well.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.ShortHorizonDays
member.summary: Number of days out that the ShortHorizonMinMfgLotSize and ShortHorizonMaxMfgLotSize will be used instead of MinLotSize and MaxLotSize.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.ShortHorizonMinMfgLotSize
member.summary: This is the Short Horizon minimum manufacturing lot size. If the required quantity is less than this amount then MRP will create a job with this production quantity. The excess amount will be sent to stock. Zero is no minimum. If nonzero, this field must be an even multiple of the MfgLotMultiple field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.ShortHorizonMaxMfgLotSize
member.summary: This is the Short Horizon maximum manufacturing lot size. If the required quantity is greater than this amount then MRP will create additional job(s) to satisfy the required production quantity. Zero is no maximum. If nonzero, this field must be an even multiple of the MfgLotMultiple field. Example: Required Quantity = 500, Maximum Lot Size = 150, 4 jobs will be created with production quantities of 150, 150, 150, and 50.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.LimitProdYldRecalc
member.summary: If set = true and the production yield is being recalculated for an assembly or any of its subassemblies, then the recalculation and quantity adjustments will stop at the assembly level and reduce the overrun quantity and if necessary adjust the PullQty rather than rolling up to its parent

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.QtyBearing
member.summary: Sets the default for Part.QtyBearing. The Part.QtyBearing fields works in conjunction with the Part.Non-Stock field to enable the part master parts to be setup for expense items.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.PcntTolerance
member.summary: Percent Tolerance. Entered as a positive number, Used to define the default percent tolerance for parts for which no percent tolerance is set up in PartWhse. Zero indicates that any quantity variance is considered out of tolerance. A number greater than zero indicates that a percentage difference between the count quantity and the frozen quantity by more than the percent tolerance figure is considered out of tolerance. Calculated as ?adjustment qty / frozen qty? expressed as a percent.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.CalcPcnt
member.summary: False = there is no percent tolerance consideration and any percent variance is considered within tolerance. True = percent tolerance is active for this part/Site and the value in PcntTolerance will be used to determine if the count variance is within tol

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.CalcQty
member.summary: False = there is no quantity tolerance consideration and any quantity variance is considered within tolerance. True = quantity tolerance is active for this part/Site and the value in QtyTolerance will be used to determine if the count variance is within t

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.CalcValue
member.summary: False = there is no value tolerance consideration and any value variance is considered within tolerance. True = value tolerance is active for this part/Site and the value in ValueTolerance will be used to determine if the count variance is within toleranc

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.QtyAdjTolerance
member.summary: Used to provide a means to control whether a count quantity discrepancy should be posted as an adjustment to inventory. This value is used for parts for which no qty adj tolerance is set up in PartWhse. Zero indicates all quantity adjustments will be posted. This parameter is used to control the count discrepancy of parts that are counted by weight on a scale. Counts often vary based upon humidity. If the count of the part is within this tolerance but different from the frozen quantity then no inventory adjustment will be posted.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.QtyTolerance
member.summary: Quantity tolerance. Entered as a positive whole number, Used to define the default quantity tolerance for parts for which no quantity tolerance is set up in PartWhse. Zero indicates that any quantity variance is considered out of tolerance. A number greater than zero indicates that a count quantity that varies from the frozen quantity by more than the quantity tolerance figure is considered out of tolerance.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartPlantRow.ValueTolerance
member.summary: Value tolerance. Entered as a positive number. Used to define the default value tolerance for parts for which no value tolerance is set up in PartWhse, PartSite, WarehseABC or SiteConfABC An entry of zero will indicate that any value variance will be con

member.summary: The operation number PartOpr.OprSeq) that is marked to do the Automatic Receipt to inventory. Note: Zero = no operation is set to perform the auto receive into inventory function. This field is not directly maintainable. Instead it is set during operation maintenance by having the user mark a check box indicating "Auto Receive" which then updates this field with the operations sequence number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartRevRow.FinalOpr
member.summary: The sequence of the operation that is to be considered as the operation which indicates the quantity complete for the Job/Assembly. In other words this operations completed quantity = Job/Assembly completed. Note: Zero = no operation is set and that the system should use the last operation to determine quantity complete. This field is not directly maintainable. Instead it is set during operation maintenance by having the user mark a check box indicating "Final Operation" which then updates this field with the operations sequence number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartCOPartRow.MtlCostBase

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.DemandQty
member.summary: A summary of the outstanding quantities for order open sales releases that are being filled from stock and of the open job material requirements that are to be issued from stock (JobMtl.Buyit = No) for this Part within a specific warehouse. The system calculates Available as OnhandQty - AllocatedQty.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.ReservedQty
member.summary: A summary of the reserved quantities for order open sales releases for this Part within a specific warehouse. NOTE: This value is the TOTAL of reservations in PartAlloc.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.AllocatedQty
member.summary: A summary of the allocated quantities for order open sales releases for this Part within a specific warehouse. NOTE: This value is the TOTAL of allocation in PartAlloc.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.PickingQty
member.summary: Quantity that is in the picking process for orders. A summary of PartAlloc.PickingQty for all demand.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.PickedQty
member.summary: Stock Quantity picked for orders. A summary of PartAlloc.PickedQty for all demand.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.CountedDate
member.summary: Date last counted. Updated during the Inventory Posting Process. Not directly maintainable by user.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.OnHandQty
member.summary: A summary of PartBin.OnHandQty for the warehouse where the bin is a nettable bin (WhseBin.NonNettable = NO). Maintained via the PartBin write trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.NonNettableQty
member.summary: A summary of PartBin.OnHandQty for the warehouse where the bin is a non nettable bin (WhseBin.NonNettable = YES). Maintained via the PartBin write trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.BuyToOrderQty
member.summary: A summary of Demand that is Buy To Order and thus should not take away from Available inventory.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.SalesDemandQty
member.summary: A summary of the outstanding quantities for order open sales releases that are being filled from stock for this Part within a specific warehouse. The system calculates Available as OnhandQty - AllocatedQty.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.SalesReservedQty
member.summary: A total of inventory quantities that has been reserved for sales orders. A summary of PartAlloc.ReservedQty for sales order allocations against stock (PartAlloc.OrderNum > 0 & SupplyJobNum = blank).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.SalesAllocatedQty
member.summary: New in 9.00. A summary of outstanding quantities for order open sales releases that are being filled from stock and have not been reserved, selected for picking or picked. Calculated as OurStockQty - ReservedQty + PickingQty + PickedQty). Note: ReservedQty, PickingQty, PickedQty are summaries of PartAlloc records with a blank job, related to an OrderRel. The system tracks allocation summaries in the following sequence; AllocQty--> ReservedQty--> PickingQty--> PickedQty.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.SalesPickingQty
member.summary: Quantity that is in the picking process for sales orders. A summary of PartAlloc.PickingQty where PartAlloc.OrderNum > 0 A summary of PartAlloc.PickingQty for sales order that are being picked from stock (PartAlloc.OrderNum > 0 & SupplyJobNum = blank).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.SalesPickedQty
member.summary: Stock Quantity picked for sales orders. A summary of PartAlloc.PickedQty for sales order picked from stock (PartAlloc.OrderNum > 0 & SupplyJobNum = blank).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.JobDemandQty
member.summary: A summary of the outstanding quantities for job material requirements that are being filled from stock for this Part within a specific warehouse.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.JobReservedQty
member.summary: Summary of mfg demands on released jobs. That is, a summary of outstanding JobMtl and JobAsmbl.PullQty where JobHead.JobFirm = Yes and JobReleased = Yes

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.JobAllocatedQty
member.summary: New in 9.00. Summary of stock allocated for jobs.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.JobPickingQty
member.summary: Quantity that is in the picking process for jobs. A summary of PartAlloc.PickingQty where PartAlloc.JobNum <> ''.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.JobPickedQty
member.summary: Stock Quantity picked for jobs.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.UnfirmJobDemandQty
member.summary: New in 9.00. Summary of mfg demand requirements on unfirm jobs. That is, a summary of outstanding JobMtl.RequiredQty and JobAsmbl.PullQty where JobHead.JobFirm = No.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.TFOrdDemandQty
member.summary: A summary of the outstanding quantities for transfer order requirements that are being filled from stock for this Part within a specific warehouse. The system calculates Available as OnhandQty - AllocatedQty.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.TFOrdReservedQty
member.summary: Summary of Transfer Order Reserved Qty for this Part in this Warehouse.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.TFOrdAllocatedQty
member.summary: Summary of Transfer Order Allocated Qty for this Part in this Warehouse.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.TFOrdPickingQty
member.summary: Quantity that is in the picking process for transfer orders. A summary of PartAlloc.PickingQty where PartAlloc.TFOrdNum > 0.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.TFOrdPickedQty
member.summary: Stock Quantity picked for transfer orders.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.KBCode
member.summary: Uniquely indentifies the record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.MinimumQty
member.summary: Indicates the desired minimum on-hand quantity. This is used by the time phase requirements report when user requests to show any parts that will or have fallen below this level. It is also used as a selection parameter for the inventory reorder report. This is an optional field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.MaximumQty
member.summary: Use to set a Maximum quantity limit that is desired to be on-hand. This field is used as a selection option by the inventory reorder report to show all parts that are over this limit. This field is optional.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.SafetyQty
member.summary: Safety quantity is a "purchasing cushion" limit. It's the amount you would need to have to cover your requirements until a shipment arrives from the vendor. If your on-hand quantity falls below this limit it means that there is a good chance that you will run out of material before the next shipment arrives. This value is used by the inventory reorder report and the time phase report. It is an optional field. Note: Safety + Minimum = Reorder Point... using this formula the reorder point is the amount at which to reorder to maintain at least the prescribed minimum quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.KBPONUM
member.summary: Purchase order number that the detail line item is linked to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.KBPOLine
member.summary: The line number of the detail record on the purchase order. This number uniquely identifies the record within the Purchase Order number. The number not directly maintainable, it's assigned by the system when records are created. The user references this item during PO receipt process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.KBWarehouseCode
member.summary: Kanban Warehouse

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.KBBinNum
member.summary: Identifies the Bin location that contains an Onhand quantity for this Part within a warehouse. The PartBin.BinNum can be blank (indicating bin tracking is not used for this part) or it must be valid in the WhseBin table.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.KBPlant
member.summary: Site Identifier. This field cannot be blank.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.KBQty
member.summary: Indicates the desired minimum on-hand Kanban quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.PcntTolerance
member.summary: Percent Tolerance. Entered as a positive number, Used to define the default percent tolerance. Zero indicates that any quantity variance is considered out of tolerance. A number greater than zero indicates that a percentage difference between the count quantity and the frozen quantity by more than the percent tolerance figure is considered out of tolerance. Calculated as ?adjustment qty / frozen qty? expressed as a percent.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.CalcPcnt
member.summary: False = there is no percent tolerance consideration and any percent variance is considered within tolerance. True = percent tolerance is active for this part/whs and the value in PcntTolerance will be used to determine if the count variance is within tolerance.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.CalcQty
member.summary: False = there is no quantity tolerance consideration and any quantity variance is considered within tolerance. True = quantity tolerance is active for this part/whse and the value in QtyTolerance will be used to determine if the count variance is within tolerance.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.CalcValue
member.summary: False = there is no value tolerance consideration and any value variance is considered within tolerance. True = value tolerance is active for this part/whse and the value in ValueTolerance will be used to determine if the count variance is within tolerance.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.QtyAdjTolerance
member.summary: Used to provide a means to control whether a count quantity discrepancy should be posted as an adjustment to inventory. Zero indicates all quantity adjustments will be posted. This parameter is used to control the count discrepancy of parts that are counted by weight on a scale. Counts often vary based upon humidity. If the count of the part is within this tolerance but different from the frozen quantity then no inventory adjustment will be posted.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.CalcQtyAdj
member.summary: False = there is no qty adj tolerance setting at the PartWhse level (so the setting in PartSite will be used). True = qty adj tolerance is active for this part/whs and the value in QtyAdjTolerance will be used to determine if the count variance should be

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.MinAbc
member.summary: Moved from PartSite. When the system sets the ABC class, it will not allow the class to be lower than this class.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.SystemAbc
member.summary: Moved from PartSite. ABC Classification calculated by the system based on Stock Valuation Percent. This is maintainable by the user if ManualABC = true.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.ManualABC
member.summary: This will lock the SystemABC code preventing the automatic determination by the Calculate ABC Codes process, which will not reset the ABC code on parts that have the flag set.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.LastCCDate
member.summary: The last date this part was cycle counted. This date is used to insure that a part will be selected for cycle counting at the appropriate time. This is different than the CountedDate field, which will be updated for either a cycle count or physical inventory.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.OvrrideCountFreq
member.summary: This flag indicates whether the CountFreq defined in this record should over ride the count frequency in the AbcCode, SiteConfABC or WarehseABC tables.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.CountFreq
member.summary: If greater than zero this setting overrides values in AbcCode, SiteConfABC and Warehse.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.QtyTolerance
member.summary: Quantity tolerance. Entered as a positive whole number, Used to define the default quantity tolerance. Zero indicates that any quantity variance is considered out of tolerance. A number greater than zero indicates that a count quantity that varies from the frozen quantity by more than the quantity tolerance figure is considered out of tolerance.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartWhseRow.ValueTolerance
member.summary: Value tolerance. Entered as a positive number. Used to define the default value tolerance. An entry of zero will indicate that any value variance will be considered out of tolerance for this part. Value variance is calculated as the difference in cost between the counted quantity and the frozen quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartUOMRow.ConvFactor
member.summary: Value used to convert to/from base uom for the specific part. Cannot change if it's base uom of UOMClass (always 1.0) Sometimes a unit of measure conversion is relative to a specific part. These are non-standard conversions. For example; 1 box(bx) of Part A is 12ea. 1(bx) of Part B is 24ea. Non-standard conversions are defined in the PartUOM table. When ConvOperator = * then ConvFactor is 1 UOM expressed in Base UOM else it is 1 Base UOM expressed in UOM

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartUOMRow.Active
member.summary: Indicates if the PartUOM is Active. This field is ready only and is used for internal logic purposes only.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartUOMRow.TrackOnHand
member.summary: If true then Onhand Quantity will be tracked per this UOM for this part.

member.summary: The Part's Net Volume.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartUOMRow.NetVolumeUOM
member.summary: Qualifies the unit of measure of the NewVolume field. Must be a UOMConv of the UOMClass with ClassType of "volume". Use UOMClass.DefUOMCode of the "volume" UOMClass as a default when creating new part records. Having a Net Volume UOM will provides the ability to calculate total volume

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartUOMRow.HasBeenUsed
member.summary: This indicates that this Part UOM has been used somewhere. Therefore we do not want to allow the associated part specific conversion to change.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartUOMRow.ConvOperator
member.summary: Indicates the mathmatical operator that is used for performing the UOM Conversion. Options are "*" (Multiply) or "\" (Divide). For example for Feet to Inch where Inch is the base uom. You could have 1ft / 12 = 1In

member.summary: Job Number. Associates the assembly record back its parent JobHead record. Not directly maintainable.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartGetDMRListRow.AssemblySeq
member.summary: A sequence number that uniquely identifies the JobAsmbl record within the JobNum. This can be user assigned or assigned by the system. The system assigns the next available number during add mode if its left blank.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartGetDMRListRow.MtlSeq
member.summary: A sequence number that uniquely defines the Material (JobMtl) record within a specific Job/Assembly. This is system assigned. The next available number is determined by reading last JobMtl record on the Job/Assembly and then adding ten to it.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartGetDMRListRow.OprSeq
member.summary: A sequence number which uniquely identifies the operation record within the Job/lot/level. The sequence can be system generated or assigned by user. System generated numbers are determined by reading last JobOper for the job/lot/level and then figures out what the next number that is divisible by 10. If this number is within 3 of the last Number on file it will be bumped up another 10. This keeps a minimum of 2 available sequences between records. For example if last = 18 Next would be 30, If last = 17 next = 20.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartGetDMRListRow.ResourceID
member.summary: The ID of the Resource that was used to do the work. This field will be used to run reports using LaborDtl records to show how much work has been done on a specific Resource. This ID is directly entered in labor entry and Labor collection. It is only prompted for if the JcSyst.MachinePrompt = Yes/

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartListRow.SearchWord
member.summary: An abbreviated part description field by which the user can search the Part file. In Part maintenance the Search Word is to only be updated upon initial creation of the Part with the first 8 bytes of the Part.Description.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartListRow.PartDescription
member.summary: Describes the Part.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartListRow.ClassID
member.summary: The Inventory class that this Part belongs to. The Class field can be blank or must be valid in the PartClass master file. Classes could be set up for different type of raw materials. It will primarily be used as a report selection parameter.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartListRow.IUM
member.summary: Primary Inventory Unit of Measure. The unit costs, are based on this uom. Used as a default for issue transactions for the part. Part onhand and allocation quantities are tracked by this uom. The quantities can also be tracked by other uoms (see PartUOM table) but tracking at this uom is mandatory. Use UOMClass.DefUOMCode of the system default UOMClass when creating new part records (see XASyst.DefUOMClassID).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartListRow.PUM
member.summary: The Purchasing Unit of measure for the Part. During Part Maintenance the XaSyst.UM is used as a default for this field. This is used in Purchase Order entry as the default on line item details.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartListRow.TypeCode
member.summary: Classifies Parts into the following... M = Manufactured Part. P = Purchased Part This type code does limit referencing any part in any way. For example a type "P" can be entered on a sales order, or a type "M" can be referenced in a Purchase Order. This field will also be used as a selection parameter in certain reports, such as Time Phase Requirements.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartListRow.NonStock
member.summary: A flag which indicates if this Part is not a stocked inventory item. This can be used so that "custom" built items which only exist per the customers order can be established as a valid part in order to provide default descriptions etc.... This can also be used for parts that are only purchased for direct use on jobs, but would normally never exist in inventory. This value will be used in report selection criteria. It also controls the default setting of the "Make" flag in order entry line items and the "Purchase" flag in Job material records. If a NoStock part is referenced in order entry then it defaults as "Make". If it is referenced on a job material requirement it will default as "Purchase"

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartListRow.ProdCode
member.summary: Product Group ID for the Part. This can be blank or must be valid in the ProdGrup file. This will be used for report sorting and selection. Also as a default in order entry, invoice entry and job entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartListRow.InActive
member.summary: Flag which indicates if the Part Master is considered as "Inactive". This flag will be used to exclude parts from certain searches and reports.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartListRow.Method
member.summary: An internal flag which indicates that this part contains Method of Manufacture details (PartMtl/PartOpr records). We use this to avoid processing raw material part records during processes such as BOM Cost roll up, Indented BOM lists, etc...

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartListRow.TrackLots
member.summary: Indicates if Lot numbers are prompted for in transactions for this part. Backflushing and AutoReceiving functions are ignored when TrackLots = Yes.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartListRow.TrackDimension
member.summary: Onhand quantity is always tracked in the Parts primary inventory uom (Part.IUM). Checking this box indicates that you want to allow tracking of onhand quantity by additional uoms. The actual UOMs to be tracked for the part are indicated by PartUOM.TrackOnHand. In order to set the PartUOM.TrackOhHand = True the Part.TrackDimension must = true. This replaces the old 8.3 Track Dimension feature

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartListRow.TrackSerialNum
member.summary: Indicates if this part is serial number tracked

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartListRow.PhantomBOM
member.summary: A flag which indicates if this Part is a "Phantom BOM".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartListRow.OnHold
member.summary: Indicates that the part is on hold. This feature can be used to indicate that a new part is not yet approved, that it is being phased out, has a quality issue, etc. Further demands/supplies of this part should not be made. Similar to an "Inactive" part. However at the moment it still may have an onhand balance, supply and demands and will be reflected in stock status reporting.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PartListRow.QtyBearing
member.summary: Indicates a Quantity Bearing part. Works in conjunction with the Non-Stock field to enable the part master parts to be setup for expense items. Quantity Bearing will be set to Yes by default and only enable to be set to No if the Non-Stock flag is Yes.
